docs.lead_paragraph: CONCORD, N.H. -- With tears in her eyes, Sandra Burt, who lives with her husband in a double-wide mobile home here and said she can barely afford the medication she needs every month, sat across a table from Senator Barack Obama and asked him what he could do to help.

headline.main: Obama Hears Middle-Class Concerns in N.H.

docs.abstract: During a campaign swing through New Hampshire, Barack Obama hosted a discussion with local residents on economic issues.
docs.snippet: During a campaign swing through New Hampshire, Barack Obama hosted a discussion with local residents on economic issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: I've been alerted to an interesting Boston Globe article about Barack Obama's role, when he was in the Illinois legislature, in the attempt to get the state committed to universal health care. It turns out that the story very much prefigures the debates we're having right now.
docs.abstract: I've been alerted to an interesting Boston Globe article about Barack Obama's role, when he was in the Illinois legislature, in the attempt to get the state committed to universal health care. docs.lead_paragraph: The United States transportation secretary will announce an agreement with the airlines to ease congestion at Kennedy International Airport next summer by shifting some flights to less busy times, Matthew L. Wald reports. As a result, the department will not, at least for now, order a reduction in the number of flights per hour at Kennedy, and will not immediately issue rules to carry out a more controversial tactic - auctioning off landing slots - to reduce the number of flights to Kennedy.

headline.main: A New Agreement to Reduce Congestion at J.F.K.

docs.lead_paragraph: “Among the many paradoxes of Potomac Land is that it is, ostensibly, the capital of the most egalitarian people on the planet, and yet it has embraced a status system that is both hierarchical and byzantine.”
